item.content:encoded:
Social networking site Twitter has set a temporary limit on the number of tweets users can read in a day. Elon Musk, the owner of this social media, announced this last Sunday.

Elon Musk announced on Twitter that a maximum of 600 posts per day can be read from accounts that are not verified. 300 posts can be read from new accounts that are not verified.

But in case of verified account, the number of daily post reading will be 6 thousand. Elon Musk says data theft has ‘reached extremes’. To combat this, user posts are temporarily limited.

Last Friday, many users were asked to log in to view tweets. Musk said the conditions were imposed on users as an immediate emergency measure.

Arguing in favor of limiting users’ tweets, Elon Musk said that Twitter’s “stacks” of data are reducing the quality of service for ordinary users.

Elon Musk bought Twitter for 4 thousand 4 billion US dollars last year after many struggles. After becoming the owner, he announced layoffs. In one blow, the employees of the company were reduced from 8 thousand to 1500.

He had to face a lot of criticism for this. Elon Musk then canceled the opportunity to become a verified user (blue ticked account) on Twitter for free. Now in exchange for money user account has blue tick.
